metadata.positioning: The operations layer that keeps bookings moving

content.headline: The operations layer that keeps bookings moving.
content.subheadline: Client communication, booking, and follow-up — handled in one calm system that doesn't rely on memory anymore.
content.bodyText: Handled replaces scattered websites, emails, texts, and mental load with a single storefront and source of truth — so nothing drops, clients stay confident, and revenue keeps flowing.

sections.imageDescription: Hero section - clean, calm visual that conveys organization and flow

content.headline: You're great at what you do.
content.subheadline: Running the business part shouldn't feel this hard.
bodyParagraphs: You didn't become a photographer, planner, coach, or consultant because you love designing websites, writing copy, or chasing messages across five places.
But right now, your business probably lives in:
bulletPoints: one website that never quite feels right
booking tools that don't talk to each other
emails, texts, DMs, and phone calls scattered everywhere
follow-ups you're holding in your head
consequences: That's how deposits don't get collected.
That's how really good professionals end up feeling disorganized — even when they're not.
content.closingStatement: Handled exists so client communication and coordination don't rely on memory or vigilance anymore.

sections.imageDescription: No image - text-focused section showing the scattered nature of current tools

content.headline: Handled is the operations layer beneath your business.
content.bodyText: Handled sits underneath your service business and quietly holds everything together — before, during, and after the booking.

sections.imageDescription: Minimal visual - possibly a simple diagram showing Handled as a foundation layer

features.title: An Optimized Storefront
features.description: Your public front door — services, pricing, availability, booking, and payments — structured so clients can move forward without friction.
features.elaboration: It's clear. It's professional. And it's something you're actually proud to send people to.

features.title: A Single Source of Truth
features.description: Every booking becomes a shared space where messages, changes, files, and decisions live — instead of being scattered across email, text, and notes.
features.elaboration: No more digging. No more "did we already cover this?"

features.title: Built-In Coordination
features.description: Routine questions get handled, context stays intact, and important moments surface when attention is actually required — not constantly.
features.elaboration: Your business keeps moving, even when you're not actively managing it.

features.title: Revenue Continuity
features.description: Follow-ups, reviews, repeat bookings, and next steps happen naturally, in context — instead of as forgotten to-dos.
features.elaboration:
Handled doesn't just reduce stress.
It protects revenue.

sections.imageDescription: Feature cards or icons - simple, professional iconography for each feature

content.headline: What it feels like to use Handled
content.intro:
Most people expect setup.
They're surprised by how fast things click.

milestones.label: Day one
milestones.description:
You have a short conversation to set up your website, services, and availability.

Five minutes later, you have a site that looks right — and feels like you.

milestones.label: Week one
milestones.description:
Handled looks at your local market and helps you define clear services and pricing that make sense for where you live and who you serve.

No guessing. No undercharging "just to be safe."

milestones.label: One quiet night
milestones.description:
While you're asleep, a client books.

Handled checks your calendar.
Answers their questions.
Collects a deposit.

You wake up to a notification that money came in — without a single back-and-forth.

milestones.label: The job
milestones.description:
Everything you need to know about that client lives in one place.

The work goes off without friction.
The client feels taken care of.

milestones.label: After
milestones.description:
The client leaves a review.
The project stays alive.
Rebooking is easy — not a restart.

content.closingStatement:
Handled doesn't make you better at your craft.
It makes everything around your craft stop getting in the way.

sections.imageDescription: Timeline or journey visualization - could be vertical steps or horizontal flow

content.headline: Designed for how buying is changing
content.bodyText:
Clients are starting to rely on personal assistants and intelligent systems to research, schedule, and coordinate services.

Handled is structured so your business can be clearly understood and correctly engaged — whether the request comes from a person or an assistant acting on their behalf.
content.reassurance:
You don't need to manage this shift.
Handled already accounts for it.
content.tagline:
Humans now.
Agent-readable next.
Same calm system underneath.

sections.imageDescription: Abstract visual showing human and AI interaction converging on the same system

content.headline: Who Handled is for
content.intro: Handled is for service professionals where:
forCriteria: client communication continues after the booking
content.examples: Photographers. Wedding planners. Chefs. Coaches. Consultants.
content.valueStatement: If you sell expertise and trust, this is your operations layer.
notForCriteria: businesses built on volume over clarity

sections.imageDescription: No images - clean text layout with clear distinction between for/not for

tiers.name: Handled
features: Clear visibility into what's happening and what's next
tiers.targetAudience: For professionals who want fewer dropped balls and cleaner bookings.

tiers.name: Fully Handled
features: Priority handling as your business grows
tiers.valueStatement:
If Handled does nothing else, it must generate booking revenue and remove operational drag.

This is the level where that really happens.

sections.imageDescription: Two pricing cards side by side - clean, professional, with clear visual hierarchy favoring Fully Handled

content.headline: Built by someone who lived the problem
content.bodyText:
Handled was built by a private chef and photographer who spent two decades juggling clients, messages, websites, and multiple businesses — not because he lacked discipline, but because the systems never existed.

Handled is the system he needed then — and the one service professionals need now.

sections.imageDescription: Optional founder photo or keep text-only for authenticity

items.question: Is this just another booking tool?
items.answer: No. Booking is the entry point. Handled is what keeps everything after the booking from fragmenting.

items.question: Do I need to be "good at tech" to use this?
items.answer: No. The point is that you don't have to become someone you're not.

items.question: Is this all AI-driven?
items.answer: Handled uses intelligence where it helps and stays out of the way where it doesn't.

sections.imageDescription: Accordion-style FAQ layout, no decorative images

content.headline: Stop running your business on memory.
content.bodyText: Install the operations layer that keeps bookings moving — and lets you focus on the work only you can do.

sections.imageDescription: Clean CTA section - brand color background, single focused button
